- PackageManagement
- PowerShellGet
- PSDesiredStateConfiguration

comments.author: ScriptAutomate
comments.body:
I get a more extensive version of issues with Update-Help, not just limited to the four mentioned in this issue.

OS: Ubuntu 14.04
PowerShell Version: v6.0.0-alpha.9

Error message when running Update-Help:

update-help : Failed to update Help for the module(s) 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive, Microsoft.PowerShell.Core, Microsoft.PowerShell.Host, Microsoft.PowerShell.Management, Microsoft.PowerShell.Security,      Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility, PackageManagement, PowerShellGet, PSReadLine' with UI culture(s) {en-US} : The type initializer for 'System.Management.Automation.Internal.CabinetExtractorFactory' threw an exception.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: Changing title to fix help for those modules. We might want to ship the help with PowerShell 6.0 itself, but it could also make sense to just get Update-Help working (which @adityapatwardhan is working on).

comments.author: Francisco-Gamino
comments.body:
@joeyaiello : Update/save-help already worked on Linux. This was fix by my PR https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/2164.

The only standing issue is that help content for Pester and PSDesiredStateConfiguration is not available on Linux. This could be because we do not have .zip files with content on the Download Center. @adityapatwardhan  could you please confirm?

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: I worded my statement a little casually. I know that Update-Help as a cmdlet works, I just meant we need to "enable the Update-Help pipeline for these modules". And you're right, that means uploading all this content to Azure blob storage (we're not using the Download Center anymore).

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: @adityapatwardhan have you already solved this problem?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
Update-Help works on Linux, this doesn't seem like it is needed anymore?
@adityapatwardhan  to verify

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body:
This is fixed by: 
PackageManagement: https://github.com/OneGet/oneget/pull/323
PSGet: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellGet/pull/195
PSReadline: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docs/pull/1709

title: Fix help for PackageManagement, PowerShellGet, PSDesiredStateConfiguration, and PSReadLine
